Sentence.sentence: While rich parents are more concerned with their children's psychological well-being, poor parents are more worried about their children's safety.
While bullying is parents' greatest concern over all, nearly half of low-income parents worry their child will get shot, compared with one-fifth of high-income parents.
They are more worried about their children being depressed or anxious.
They are more likely to grow up in neighborhoods that their parents say aren't great for raising children, and their parents worry about them getting shot, beaten up or in trouble with the law.
There are usually two parents, who spend a lot of time reading to children and worrying about their anxiety levels and hectic schedules.
The popularization of digital video recorders has caused advertisers to worry that their commercials will be skipped.
No wonder parents worry their own kids might spin out of control once they hit the turbulent waters of adolescence.

it is unfair to those climate-vulnerable nationsit aims to keep temperature rise below 2 ℃  onlyit is beneficial to only fewer than 4% of countriesit burdens developed countries with the sole responsibilityThey needn't worry about the food and water they consume.
Consumers  are  often  hesitant  to  try  smart-home  devices  because  they  are  worried  about  compatibility  problems.
Consumers  are  becoming  more  worried  about  giving  personal  information  to  tech  companies  to  get  customized products and services.
However, they also deserve a home of their own, a secure retirement and freedom from worrying about unpaid bills.

We worry most about now because if we don't survive for the next minute, we're not going to be around in ten years' time, says Professor Elke Weber of the Centre for Research on Environmental Decisions at Columbia University in New York.

Should doctors consider Medicare's budget in deciding what to use?I think ethically（在道德层面上） we are just worried about the patient in front of us and not trying to save money for the insurance industry or society as a whole, said Dr.Donald Jensen.Still
The Obama administration does worry publicly about manufacturing, a first cousin of craftsmanship.
I'm not someone who's anti-technology, but I'm always worried that technology becomes an end in and of itself, and it replaces teaching or it replaces analysis.
The rush to distribute the devices worries some professors, who say that students are less likely to participate in class if they are multi-tasking.
If Americans saved more and spent less, consistently over time, they wouldn't have to worry about all that.
To tell Americans not to worry about their economy
What worried them most, in other words, was the fiscal (财政的) burden of immigration.
Why are American scholars worried about education today?
Maybe we'd better allow an extra month, so we won't have to worry about being late.
This truck looks like what I need but I'm worried about maintenance.

"We worry most about now because if we don't survive for the next minute, we're not going to be around in ten years' time," says Professor Elke Weber of the Centre for Research on Environmental Decisions at Columbia University in New York.

Sentence.sentence: "Make mathematics more available," Draujlcova says. Redesign it so it's more accessible to more kinds of people: young children, adults who worry about it, adults who may have had bad experiences."

Sentence.sentence: A bonus with the "keep-moving principle" is that while we keep moving, we don't have a chance to worry?

Sentence.sentence: Although the planned operation will be located more than miles away, drawing the soda ash in through pipelines, conservationists worry it could still upset the natural water cycle and breeding grounds.

Sentence.sentence: Communication also helps for those who worry about jeopardizing a collaboration, he says.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: However, the professors need not worry so much.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Mott survey found among the 56 percent of mothers and 34 percent of fathers who discussed parenting on social media, 72 percent of them said sharing made them feel less alone, and nearly as many said sharing helped them worry less and gave them advice fro
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Of course, some worry lies in replacing agricultural workers.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Redesign it so it's more accessible to more kinds of people: young children, adults who worry about it, adults who may have had bad experiences.

Sentence.sentence: The last time a major earthquake occurred along the Cascadia fault was in 1700, so officials worry that another event could occur any time.

Sentence.sentence: They worry that the adolescent peer group has the power to push its members into behavior that is foolish and even dangerous.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"焦虑，关心"之意。
means: anxiety ：指对预料中的不祥之事的焦虑。
worry ：侧重对未知事态演变的忧虑。
care ：强调因出于责任感或顾虑等而产生的不安。
concern ：作"关心"用时，是indifference(冷漠)的反义词，侧重对他人健康、安全等的关心，也可暗示对困难、危险或失败等的忧虑。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"烦恼，担忧"之意。
means: worry ： 普通用词，着重使人焦虑、烦恼或深深不安。
brood语气比worry强，多指沉思、沮丧或忧郁。
care ： 多指极强烈的关心和忧虑。常带纯客观的意味。
fret ： 通常指因悲哀、焦虑或忧愁等所困扰的心理状态。

Sentence.sentence: It could be anything―gardening, cooking, music, sports—but whatever it is, make sure it's a relief from daily stress rather than another thing to worry about.

Sentence.sentence: Nasa is worried about two things: recovery time once astronauts return home, and, more importantly, how to maintain strength and fitness for the two and a half years or more that it would take to make a round-trip to mars.

entry.def: If you worry, you keep thinking about problems that you have or about unpleasant things that might happen.

example.ex: Don't worry, your luggage will come on afterwards by taxi...
example.tran: 别担心，你的行李随后会由出租车送过来。
我无时无刻不为她担心。

entry.def: If someone or something worries you, they make you anxious because you keep thinking about problems or unpleasant things that might be connected with them.

example.ex: I'm still in the early days of my recovery and that worries me...
example.tran: 我还处于恢复的早期阶段，这让我很担心。

example.ex: 'Why didn't you tell us?' — 'I didn't want to worry you.'...
example.tran: “你为什么不告诉我们？”“我不想让你们担心。”

entry.def: If someone or something does not worry you, you do not dislike them or you are not annoyed by them.

example.ex: It wouldn't worry me if he came to my house, but I don't know if I would go out of my way to ask him.
example.tran: 我倒不介意他来我家，但我不知道自己是否会特意邀请他。

entry.def: Worry is the state or feeling of anxiety and unhappiness caused by the problems that you have or by thinking about unpleasant things that might happen.

example.ex: The admission shows the depth of worry among the Tories over the state of the economy...
example.tran: 这一认可表明了保守党党内对经济状况的忧虑之深。

example.ex: His last years were overshadowed by financial worry.
example.tran: 他生命的最后几年穷困潦倒，十分惨淡。

entry.def: A worry is a problem that you keep thinking about and that makes you unhappy.
entry.tran: 使人担心(或发愁)的问题；烦心事

example.ex: My main worry was that Madeleine Johnson would still be there...
example.tran: 我最担心的是马德琳·约翰逊仍会在那儿。

example.ex: The worry is that the use of force could make life impossible for the UN peacekeepers...
example.tran: 让人担心的是，使用武力可能会使联合国维和人员性命难保。

entry.def: You say not to worry to someone to indicate that you are not upset or angry when something has gone wrong.
entry.tran: （表示自己并不烦恼或生气）别担心；没关系

example.ex: 'Not to worry, Baby,' he said, and kissed her tenderly.
example.tran: “没关系，宝贝儿。”他说道，然后温柔地吻了她一下。

means.word_mean: 1. something or someone that causes anxiety; a source of unhappiness;

sentences.sentence: "New York traffic is a constant concern"
"his worry over the prospect of being fired"
"it is not work but worry that kills"
"he wanted to die and end his troubles"

means.word_mean: 1. be worried, concerned, anxious, troubled, or uneasy;
3. disturb the peace of mind of; afflict with mental agitation or distress;

sentences.sentence: "I cannot sleep--my daughter's health is worrying me"
"I worry about the second Germanic consonant"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wyrgan 'strangle', of West Germanic origin. In Middle English the original sense of the verb gave rise to the meaning 'seize by the throat and tear', later figuratively 'harass', whence 'cause anxiety to' (early 19th century, the date also of the noun)

sentences.cn: 唯一的治疗办法是消除病因--烦恼和焦虑.
sentences.en: The only way to cure it is to remove the worries and anxieties that cause it.

sentences.en: Conversely, worry can give a person an ulcer, high blood pressure, or even a heart attack.

sentences.en: Worries and tenseness can lead to insomnia.

sentences.en: Spunk up, there's nothing to worry about!

sentences.cn: 小时候每当我感到忧虑害怕的时候, 保姆总是会给我唱歌.
sentences.en: When I was a child, my nursemaid sang to me whenever I was worried or afraid.

sentences.cn: 100我那时看得出老师脸上的忧虑的神情, 那种担心而又难耐的神情.
sentences.en: I could see then the anxiety upon the teacher's face, the worried impatience.

sentences.cn: 银行经理消除了我对钱款的忧虑.
sentences.en: The bank manager has ironed out all my worries about money.

sentences.cn: 你不要为前途忧虑.
sentences.en: You shall not worry about the future.

sentences.cn: 十几岁的女儿吹捧流行歌星使父母很忧虑.
sentences.en: The teenager's adulation of the top group worried her parents.

sentences.cn: 我因忧虑而感到心情沉重.
sentences.en: I feel oppressed by worry.

sentences.cn: 把我们内在的忧虑化成外在的现实, 我们就能对之更加实事求是.
sentences.en: By bringing our internal worries into external reality, we can be more realistic about them.

sentences.cn: 教育厅长对缺少合格的教师感到忧虑.
sentences.en: The school superintendent was worried about the lack of qualified teachers.

sentences.cn: 她向医生倾诉自己的忧虑.
sentences.en: She poured out her worries to the doctor.

sentences.cn: 泰国央行真正忧虑的是国内流动性过盛的问题.
sentences.en: Instead, the Bank of Thailand is more worried about excessive domestic liquidity.

sentences.cn: 罗立明不无忧虑的表示.
sentences.en: Liming not without worry express.

sentences.cn: 人口过分的拥挤和繁忙的交通使人们对这个城市十分忧虑.
sentences.en: Population excessive traffic congestion and to enable people of this city are very worried.

sentences.cn: 不要为像洪水和地震等未必会发生的事而忧虑.
sentences.en: Don't worry about such improbabilities as floods and earthquakes.

sentences.cn: 我对孩子的幸福感到忧虑.
sentences.en: I'm worried about the welfare of the children.

sentences.cn: 现在信息和娱乐已经出现令人忧虑的相互融合.
sentences.en: There is now a worrying fusion of information and entertainment.

sentences.cn: 他曾为他的报纸的前途忧虑.
sentences.en: He worried about the future of his newspeper.

sentences.cn: 对英国经济状况忧虑的增长,使英镑受到沉重打击.
sentences.en: Sterling took a battering as worries grew about the state of Britain's economy.

sentences.cn: 华盛顿对巴以之间不断升级的暴力对抗表示忧虑.
sentences.en: And Washington says it's worried by the escalating violence between the Israelisand Palestinians.

sentences.cn: 让这里有更多微笑和少量忧虑.
sentences.en: Let there be more smiles and fewer worries.

sentences.cn: 忧虑的最有力原因莫过贝卢斯科尼自己的言辞.
sentences.en: The most powerful reason to worry comes in Mr Berlusconi's own words.

sentences.cn: 碳市场的动荡也是人们的另一个忧虑.
sentences.en: The volatility of carbon markets is another worry.

sentences.cn: 所以啊,到了晚上, 把你的忧虑交给上帝吧,反正, 上帝是不睡觉的!
sentences.en: So at night, give your worries to God, He's up all right anyway!

sentences.cn: 这将消除他经济上的忧虑.
sentences.en: This will liberate him from economic worry.

sentences.cn: 忧虑自己的工作及妻子的健康问题使他陷于过分的紧张中.
sentences.en: Worry over his job and his wife's health put him under a great stress.

sentences.cn: 不必担心。我们有很多时间。
sentences.en: Don't worry . We have plenty of time.

sentences.cn: 对改变不了的事情担心也没用。
sentences.en: There's no point in worrying over things you can't change.

sentences.cn: 我担心自己进不了大学。
sentences.en: I worry that I won't get into college.

sentences.cn: 别担心，没伤着。
sentences.en: Not to worry─no harm done.

sentences.cn: 别担心，你的行李随后会由出租车送过来。
sentences.en: Don't worry, your luggage will come on afterwards by taxi...

sentences.cn: 我无时无刻不为她担心。
sentences.en: I worry about her constantly...

sentences.cn: 我还处于恢复的早期阶段，这让我很担心。
sentences.en: I'm still in the early days of my recovery and that worries me...

sentences.cn: “你为什么不告诉我们？”“我不想让你们担心。”
sentences.en: 'Why didn't you tell us?' — 'I didn't want to worry you.'...

sentences.cn: 我最担心的是马德琳·约翰逊仍会在那儿。
sentences.en: My main worry was that Madeleine Johnson would still be there...

sentences.cn: 让人担心的是，使用武力可能会使联合国维和人员性命难保。
sentences.en: The worry is that the use of force could make life impossible for the UN peacekeepers...

sentences.cn: 该计划也受到了一些计算机安全专家的质疑，他们担心施密特先生所构想的“资源生态系统”仍然会使互联网的大部分地方易受攻击。
sentences.en: The plan has also been greeted with skepticism by some computer security experts, who worry that the “voluntary ecosystem” envisioned by Mr. Schmidt would still leave much of the Internet vulnerable.

sentences.cn: 难怪父母会担心他们的孩子一旦到了动荡难测的青春期就会失去控制。
sentences.en: No wonder parents worry their own kids might spin out of control once they hit the turbulent waters of adolescence.

sentences.cn: 但是，教授们也不必太担心。

sentences.cn: 他们更有可能在家附近长大，而他们的父母认为这个环境不适合孩子成长，父母也担心孩子们会遭枪击、挨揍或者惹上法律问题。

sentences.cn: 例如，忘记一部特别喜欢的电影中的某个演员的名字，根本不必担心。但是如果你忘记了这部电影的情节，或者甚至不记得看过这部电影，这种情况则让人担忧得多，达夫勒说道。
sentences.en: Forgetting the name of an actor in a favorite movie, for example, isnothing to worry about. But if you forget the plot of the movie or don't remember even seeing it, that's far more concerning, Daffner says.
